name: Roasted Chicken
ingredients: 100 g green or black pitted olives
30 g butter or 1 tsp smen (clarified butter)
A pinch of saffron threads (soaked in a little warm water)
Salt and black pepper to taste
A bunch of fresh coriander and parsley (chopped)
steps: Clean the chicken thoroughly (inside & out) and drain.

Prepare the marinade: mix olive oil, spices (saffron, turmeric, ginger, cinnamon, ras el‑hanout if using), garlic, salt, and pepper. Rub the mixture all over the chicken (inside and out). Let it marinate 1–2 hours if possible. ([linsfood.com](https://www.linsfood.com/djaj-mhammer/?utm_source=chatgpt.com))

In a pot or Dutch oven, sauté the onions in some oil and butter/smen. Add the marinated chicken. ([infostourismemaroc.com](https://www.infostourismemaroc.com/cuisine-marocaine/poulet-mhamer?utm_source=chatgpt.com))

Add some water, the chopped preserved lemon (and zest if desired), coriander/parsley, and olives. Simmer gently until the chicken is fully cooked and the sauce is thick and rich. ([easydelice.net](https://easydelice.net/recette-poulet-roti-marocaine-djaj-mhamer/?utm_source=chatgpt.com))

Optional: after slow cooking, roast the chicken in the oven a few minutes to get a crispy golden skin. ([infostourismemaroc.com](https://www.infostourismemaroc.com/cuisine-marocaine/poulet-mhamer?utm_source=chatgpt.com))

Serve the chicken with its sauce (called Daghmira), garnished with olives and preserved lemon slices. Toasted almonds can also be added according to tradition. ([easydelice.net](https://easydelice.net/recette-poulet-roti-marocaine-djaj-mhamer/?utm_source=chatgpt.com))
